title: Supply chain analyst says there might not be M3 MacBooks this year after all
content:
For most of the last year, the rumor mill has indicated that the first wave of Apple’s M3 Macs will be hitting sometime this fall—perhaps in October, a month Apple has often used for iPad and Mac announcements that can’t be crammed into its iPhone and Apple Watch-focused product events in September.

But according to reliable Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, the company won't be launching those models before the end of the year. Kuo didn't share specifics, but he has sources inside of Apple's manufacturing supply chains that often give him reliable information about the company's plans.

Apple's timing shifted in similar ways last year, when M2-based MacBook Pro and Mac mini designs that were apparently intended for late 2022 ended up launching in January of 2023 instead.

Read 6 remaining paragraphs | Comments
author: Andrew Cunningham
